text: James Darrell McFarland (October 4, 1947 – November 27, 2020) was an American football player. He played tight end for six seasons in the National Football League (NFL) with the Buffalo Bills, St. Louis Cardinals, and Miami Dolphins.Jim McFarland NFL & AFL Football Statistics – Pro-Football- Reference.com He was born in North Platte, Nebraska. After leaving football, he became a member of the Nebraska Legislature between 1986 to 1991 as a Democrat. He unsuccessfully ran for Governor of Nebraska in 1998. McFarland died of pancreatic cancer on November 27, 2020, in Omaha, Nebraska at age 73. ==References== Category:1947 births Category:2020 deaths Category:American football tight ends Category:Buffalo Bills players Category:Miami Dolphins players Category:Arizona Cardinals players Category:State legislators of the United States Category:Politicians from Omaha, Nebraska Category:People from North Platte, Nebraska Category:Democratic Party (United States) politicians Category:Cancer deaths in Nebraska Category:Deaths from pancreatic cancer
title: Jim McFarland
